result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas R. Dollar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within 60 days (7/15/16) unless a payment plan has been established.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

16CM127 & 16CM134 (not on calendar today, Br. 3 case): Defendant Nickolas R. Dollar in court with attorney Brian Jay Smith.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today to both cases; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews charges/penalties; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Def. pleads NC to each charge; stip. to facts; Court finds pleas made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of BJ in both 16CM127 and 16CM134; State heard; Atty. Smith heard; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence; report to P&P by close of business Tues.

**W/H - 18 mo. PO conc.
- $263 CC each case
- $200 DNA surcharge and sample each case
- AODA and FT
- absolute sobriety, no bars, etc.
- not drive a mv w/o valid DL

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

1:15 - Defendant Nickolas R. Dollar in court, in custody with attorney Ramneek Singh Button (eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Return date scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
